comment.author: 57668330@N00
comment._content: Where was this to be built?

comment.author: 35740357@N03
comment._content: Hi, rockcreek, Thanks so much for the question! The initial design for the building placed it between 9th and 10th Streets along Pennsylvania Ave: www.archives.gov/about/history/building-an-archives/simon... However, the John Russell Pope design that was implemented moved the building between 7th and 8th Streets on Pennsylvania Avenue. It was always intended to be in the Federal Triangle area of DC: www.archives.gov/about/history/building-an-archives/build... Additional information about the building can be found here: www.archives.gov/about/history/building-an-archives/ - Meredith (U.S. National Archives)

comment.author: 57668330@N00
comment._content: Thanks, Meredith - given the date, I assumed it was a proposal for a separate building.  Is 5/17/40 the accession date?

comment.author: 35740357@N03
comment._content:
Hi, rockcreek,

May 17, 1940 is the date the postcard was created, even though the drawing of the proposed building is from the 1930's.  

Thanks for the question!
Meredith (U.S. National Archives)
